intro: Christella jaculosa, commonly known as the spiked bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its unique structure includes elongated, spiky bracts that surround the flowers, giving it an unusual appearance. Christella jaculosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
